title: variables
message:
variables are name identifiers bound to a section of an application called a scope
Variables can be reassigned to another value

Global variables can be accessed anywhere within the application by referencing its name

Variables are containers and can contain primitive value types like string, number, and boolean or they can point to the location of a complex memory type like an object, array, or function

Declaring a variable will create a variable with the name it was declared with but it wont be fully initialized and its value will be undefined
